name: Yau's conjecture on the first eigenvalue
rephrased: Is the first eigenvalue of the Laplace-Beltrami operator on a closed minimal hypersurface embedded in an (n+1)-dimensional sphere equal to n?
implication_form: If a closed embedded minimal hypersurface in S^{n+1} is minimal, then its first eigenvalue equals n.
explained: Yau's conjecture on the first eigenvalue states that for any embedded closed minimal hypersurface in the unit sphere S^{n+1}, the first eigenvalue of the Laplace-Beltrami operator acting on smooth functions defined on that hypersurface is exactly n. This conjecture, proposed by Shing-Tung Yau in 1982, remains unsolved as of 2018.
